Campus safety is awesome, lighted campus with Security monitoring the parking area. Excellent
Many activities and clubs students can join.
Older students like myself that are working full time and attending college part time or full time. Evening classes are available at all campuses.
Parking problems only at the Norfolk Campus
Tidewater Community College have some of the best Professor in Virginia.
All campus have all kind of activities for the student.
Depending on the Campus you attend, there are many places to eat at.
No Dorm

I have attended a four year college before Tidewater Community College, however, I have learn more for this community college then I have at a four year University. I am so glad I am a student at Tidewater Community College

Human Services is a great program at Tidewater Community College, however parking is hard and expensive at the Norfolk Campus, which all of the Human Services classes are offered. But great Professor and a amazing program.

I am currently enrolled at Tidewater Community College. I am a full time student working a full time job, so the evening classes work great for me. I am a 53 year old student so the Professor work with my work schedule on occasions.

The Students Center just opened in the summer of 2011 and is a wonderful option for students who dont want to walk too far from campus to grab a bite to eat., 202317=Currently unavailable, but will be availalbe by March 2014., 127255=The Norfolk Campus Tidewater community college was the first campus to have a student center it open on May 23,2011 that is a place were students can hang out in between classes it has five floors . The first floor is open to the public which has two cafes on that floor . The other floors can only be access if you are a tcc student with an tcc id card which is provide by the school once you are enrolled into classess., 401654=TCC doesn't have a dorm because it is a community college. TCC offers day-care starting in the beginning of January or February. Also they offer employment for students that want to work part-time while they are in school., 130464=Hello prospective students i use to be open of you but then I was at the beach and I was thinking i do not just want a high school diploma because that will not get me very far in life. textAfterTable: Am enjoying being here I love the area that the Virginia Beach campus is is. It's easy to find & it's just ten miles from the ocean front! The only problem I have had is that one evening my car was broken into in the TCC parking lot, but nothing was stolen. Am learning a lot So far, all but two of my teachers that I have had were wonderful. If you are majoring in sociology or Microsoft Office I would research your teachers hard before signing up for your classes.
